name: Mexican Ground Beef Casserole
author: AndreaF.
summary: I created this Mexican ground beef casserole when I wanted something different that I could make ahead if I wanted to. Double the recipe for company!
ingredients: 1 (6 ounce) package cornbread stuffing mix (such as Kraft® Stove Top®)
1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with jalapeno
1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers
½ teaspoon hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®), or more to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook and stir ground beef and onion in the hot skillet until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes
While the beef is cooking, make stuffing
Bring water and butter to a boil in a medium saucepan
Stir diced tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, and hot sauce into the beef mixture
Simmer until cheese is melted completely, about 1 minute
Transfer mixture to a casserole dish
Spread cornbread stuffing evenly over the top
Bake in the preheated oven until browned, 20 to 30 minutes
